title: Finite element analysis of very large bone models based on micro-CT scans
summary: High-resolution voxel-based micro-finite element ($μ$FE) models derived from $μ$CT imaging enable detailed investigation of bone mechanics but remain computationally challenging at anatomically relevant scales. This study presents a comprehensive $μ$FE framework for large-scale biomechanical analysis of an intact New Zealand White (NZW) rabbit femur, integrating advanced segmentation, scalable finite element solvers, and experimental validation using predominantly open-source libraries.
